Description: Worn white painted pottery shabti of Ğd-Mwt with a lappet-wig tied with a fillet, a summarily modelled face and crossed hands in relief holding two relief hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with Hieroglyphs; the back is decorated with a representation of a seed-basket.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore (?)
